meanings.definition: Having or following a contour or outline.
meanings.sent1: The contoured map showed all the hills and valleys clearly.
meanings.sent2: The contoured edges of the puzzle pieces made them easy to fit together.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her contoured shadow on the wall looked like a mountain range.
meanings.sent4: The contoured path through the forest led us to a hidden waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The contoured vase was both elegant and practical, fitting perfectly in her hand.

meanings.definition: Shaped to fit the form of something.
meanings.sent1: The contoured seat of the chair provided great comfort.
meanings.sent2: Her contoured dress hugged her figure beautifully.
meanings.sent3: He found a contoured rock that perfectly matched the shape of his hand.
meanings.sent4: The contoured handle of the mug made it easy to hold.
meanings.sent5: The contoured pillow supported his neck and head perfectly while he slept.

meanings.definition: To shape or mold with contour lines.
meanings.sent1: She carefully contoured the clay into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The artist contoured the landscape with precise brush strokes.
meanings.sent3: He contoured the cake to resemble a mountain for the themed party.
meanings.sent4: They contoured the garden beds to create a visually appealing design.
meanings.sent5: The makeup artist contoured her cheekbones for a more defined look on stage.
